'Marathi' (; Laurie Bauer, 2007, The Linguistics Studentâs Handbook,
Edinburgh {{unicode|MarÄá¹­hÄ«}} ) is an Indo-Aryan language. It is the
official language of Maharashtra state of India and is one of the 23 official
languages of India. It is the 19th most spoken language in the world. There were
73 million speakers in 2001. Marathi has the fourth largest number of native
speakers in India Marathi has some of the
oldest literature of all modern Indo-European, Indic languages, dating from
about 2000 years ago. arts, South Asian." EncyclopÃ¦dia Britannica.
EncyclopÃ¦dia Britannica 2007 Ultimate Reference Suite. The major dialects
of Marathi are called Standard Marathi and Warhadi Marathi.
There are a few other sub-dialects like Ahirani, Dangi, Vadvali, Samavedi,
Khandeshi, and Malwani. Standard Marathi is the official language of the State
of Maharashtra.
headings: Marathi on computers and the Internet
